page.title: 04Hamlets around Eastington
page.content:
CHURCHEND _ consists of 14 properties which include a row of 17th. century timber framed cottages, the Church built in the 13th. century, The School, built on the site of the old Rectory in 1859 but having no affiliation to the church,and Eastington Park, built in 1815 and now used by Gloucestershire County Council as an Old People's Home.
MILLEND _ consists of 11 properties including the old mill which at present is used as a warehouse for storing and exporting antique furniture.
CRESS GREEN _ consists of 14 late 18th. early 19th century cottages and is linked to Millend via a footpath known as "Coffin Lane".
